title: ETC1010 Tutorial 1
text:
🧑‍🏫 About Me

📸 I love taking pictures.
🎬 I enjoy watching movies.
🛍️ I also like shopping.
🐱 I LOVE cats.
🎵 And one lie: “I’m a professional music player.” 😉

title: ETC1010 Tutorial 1
text:
🎲 Two Truths and a Lie

Get into groups of 3 or 4.
Take turns sharing 2 truths and 1 lie about yourself.
Your group will try to guess which one is the lie.
You’ll have 10 minutes to chat.

title: ETC1010 Tutorial 1
section: 🧑‍🤝‍🧑 Now Let’s Get to Know You
text:
🧑‍🤝‍🧑 Now Let’s Get to Know You

I’m going to open the student list with names and photos.
Presence is not recorded, this is just to connect with each other.

title: ETC1010 Tutorial 1
text:

Unit details

title: ETC1010 Tutorial 1
text:
📝 Assessments

You can earn 10% easily by mini quizzes:

Record a video
Peer grading

Stay updated and use the forums to ask questions

title: ETC1010 Tutorial 1
text:
💻 Installing R and RStudio

Go to Learning Section > Week 1
Click on Installing R and R Studio

🔗 Link to tutorial: learnr.numbat.space/chapter1

title: ETC1010 Tutorial 1
text:
📊 Why R and RStudio?

This semester we’ll analyze and visualize real-world data
We use R, a powerful tool for data analysis
And RStudio, a user-friendly interface to run R

Let’s get them installed together now!

title: ETC1010 Tutorial 1
text:
💾 Installing R and RStudio

Or go directly to: posit.co/download/rstudio-desktop
Step 1: Install R
Step 2: Then install RStudio

title: ETC1010 Tutorial 1
section: ☁️ If You Can’t Install: Use RStudio Cloud
text:
☁️ If You Can’t Install: Use RStudio Cloud

Go to posit.cloud
You can login with your Google account
Click New Project → RStudio Project
RStudio will open in your web browser, no installation needed!

title: ETC1010 Tutorial 1
text:
🎨 Customising RStudio Appearance

I personally love the dark theme!
You can change the look of RStudio:

Go to Tools > Global Options > Appearance
Pick a theme you like
Click Apply

title: ETC1010 Tutorial 1
text:
🪟 RStudio Panes Overview

Console (Bottom Left) → Run and test code
Script Editor (Top Left) → Write and save your code
Environment/History (Top Right) → See stored variables and past commands
Files/Plots/Packages/Help (Bottom Right) → View plots, install packages, get help

title: ETC1010 Tutorial 1
text:
⌨️ Running Code in RStudio

To run a line of code from the script:

Mac: Command + Enter
Windows: Ctrl + Enter


Let’s try writing some code together now!

title: Tina
text:
I’m Tina and I am a PhD student in the Department of Econometrics and Business Statistics at Monash University, Australia supervised by Professor Dianne Cook, Professor Farshid Vahid-Araghi and Dr. Jessica Leung.
I am a member of Monash NUMBATs. I am currently working as a tutor in the Department of Econometrics and Business Statistics at Monash University, Australia.






























Data Analysis
High-dimensional data visualization
Dimension reduction
Data Visualization
